N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 43-1.5 - Hospital inpatient admissions

State Regulations
(a) Tuberculosis health care services provided in a hospital shall be based on prevailing standards of professional practice for the care of tuberculosis. (b) An inpatient admission of a tuberculosis patient to a hospital for treatment of tuberculosis may be made when a person has severe symptoms attributed to tuberculosis, presents diagnostic problems or presents difficulties in drug treatment selection.
